thread.title: Antonio Brown pays tribute to Pat McAfee
thread.title_full: Antonio Brown pays tribute to Pat McAfee

author: USA TODAY
title: Antonio Brown pays tribute to Pat McAfee
text:

Post to Facebook Antonio Brown pays tribute to Pat McAfee This is a perfect Pat McAfee tribute video. Check out this story on USATODAY.com: http://ftw.usatoday.com/2017/02/antonio-brown-pays-tribute-retire-pat-mcafee-hilarious-video-punt-return-hug-goal-post-sarah-maclachlan-i-will-remember-you-song-best/ Cancel Send A link has been sent to your friend's email address. Posted! A link has been posted to your Facebook feed. Join the Nation's Conversation To find out more about Facebook commenting please read the Conversation Guidelines and FAQs Antonio Brown pays tribute to Pat McAfee Alysha Tsuji , USA TODAY 10:54 p.m. ET Feb. 2, 2017 
Pittsburgh Steelers wide receiver Antonio Brown (84) waves to fans during warmups prior to the game against the Indianapolis Colts at Lucas Oil Stadium. (Photo: Aaron Doster-USA TODAY Sports) 
Colts punter Pat McAfee announced on Wednesday night that, at 29 years old, he has decided to retire from the NFL to join Barstool Sports. The next night, Steelers wide receiver and punt returner Antonio Brown paid tribute to McAfee's career with this hilarious video. Yo @PatMcAfeeShow , ðŸŽµI will remember you ðŸŽµ ðŸ˜‚ðŸ˜‚ pic.twitter.com/5tkb1orFX1 â€” Antonio Brown (@AntonioBrown) February 3, 2017 
The video is of that one time in December of 2015 when Brown returned one of McAfee's punts for a 71-yard touchdown, and then proceeded to celebrate by hugging the goal post , which made for an iconic photo. BUT the best part is that the video is set to Sarah McLachlan's I Will Remember You - a perfect touch. 
Brown and McAfee had some good times together, even though they were on different teams. In addition to the moment Brown remembered in his video, there was also that other time when McAfee tweeted at Brown asking him to please refrain from kicking him in the face . Can you leave this particular move at home this weekend boss? @AntonioBrown84 pic.twitter.com/FyeLdwJk0P â€” Pat McAfee (@PatMcAfeeShow) October 20, 2014 
Additionally, most recently, McAfee defended Brown on Twitter . The punter called out NFL Network for reporting that Brown was "pouting" after a touchdown. NFL Network..owned/operated by the NFL..reported @AntonioBrown was pouting after 1st td..so, lying 2 make superstars look bad is good 4 biz? pic.twitter.com/wU4MxMd3Ng â€” Pat McAfee (@PatMcAfeeShow) January 24, 2017 
In an interview with For The Win on Thursday, Brown also said the reports that he was pouting on the field weren't true, but I'm sure he appreciated McAfee sticking up for him beforehand. 
Anyway, even though McAfee says he won't be playing in the NFL anymore, we'll probably see more great tweets and maybe even see more interactions with players since he'll still be working in sports.
